Route: Up via the old corpse road then direct to summit; return same way or loop
Views: Views over Bassenthwaite Lake and nearby fells

Route: Little zig-zag climb up from Spooney Green Lane
Ascent via Hause Gate or from Hawse End and back via Borrowdale
Views: Classic view over Derwentwater, Borrowdale and Catbells ridge

Difficulty_Reason: Steep climb and scramble to summit
Route: From Grasmere up Easedale Road, zig-zag path and rocky scramble to “Howitzer",Views over Grasmere
Suitable_For: Experienced walkers / Those with some scrambling confidence

Route: Classic Fairfield Horseshoe (Low Pike → High Pike → Dove Crag → Hart Crag → Fairfield →…return)
Views: Broad views over Eastern Fells, Helvellyn, Windermere

Route: Long climb from Wasdale or Seathwaite, navigating rocks
Views: Views over Wasdale, Scafell Pike, Great Gable

Difficulty_Reason: Exposure and scrambling on narrow ridge
Route: Ascent via Striding Edge from Glenridding, descent via Swirral Edge or Grisedale Tarn
Views: Panoramic ridge views, plus Ullswater, Grasmere, and deeper fells

Route: Climb from Keswick through Great Wood and Cat Gill, then scramble out to crag
Views: Views over Derwentwater, Borrowdale and Keswick

Starting_Point: St John’s in the Vale (near A591)
Route: Loop from church → ridge → hause → valley → return
Up via eastern ridge or from Brownrigg Farm, panoramic ridge; return same or via loop
Views: Wide views in all directions, incl. Blencathra

Route: Classic route from Keswick / less travelled route from Bassenthwaite
Views: Expansive views from summit across Northern Fells and Derwentwater

Difficulty_Reason: Steep ascent and scrambling near summit
Route: From Seatoller up via Moses Trod and final rocky scramble
Views: Spectacular view of Wasdale, Pillar, Styhead Tarn

Route: Ascent from Crummock Water up path to ridge then to summit
Views: Great ridge views, including Crummock Water, Buttermere, and western fells

Route: Part of Fairfield Horseshoe or via Deepdale Hause
Views: Close-up views of Helvellyn, Fairfield, and Thirlmere
